name: Doubletree by Hilton Tarrytown

reviews.title: A rip-off
reviews.text: We booked a room here for the day after Thanksgiving. We booked well in advance as we were traveling with our dog. Upon arrival we were told that there would be an additional, non-refundable $150 "deposit" for the dog. We had not been informed of this when we booked the room. It was dark and raining so we reluctantly paid, needing a good rest.

reviews.title: Very Average
reviews.text: While the public areas seemed nice enough, our room was shabby and much in need of refurbishing. The mattress needed replacing, the carpet was stained, windows dirty and the bath was quite outdated. The room was at the very back of the hotel, I should say motel. We were on the first floor with a window on a parking lot where people came and went all night long.

The reception staff was unfriendly, acting as if they were doing us a favor by letting us stay there with our dog. However, we did order room service and were delightfully surprised. The room service staff was pleasant and the food quite good.
reviews.title: Very nice, mid-priced, non-luxury hotel
Good, not great.
reviews.text: I would not stay there again. By contrast we recently stayed at the Sheraton in Danbury Conneticut for a truly comfortable experience. The beds were excellent, the room clean and fresh and the staff was happy to see us and our dog. There was no $150 extra charge either.

reviews.title: Go somewhere else
reviews.text: Very average. Easy location to reach, right off the highway, which was why we stayed there. A rather spread out, rambling place, and a somewhat indifferent staff. I am surprised at how poor the Hilton chain has become. The diner right across the street was great for breakfast, though.

reviews.title: Stay Away- Bed Bugs in rooms
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel Aug 24th on business travel. I did not see any bed bugs but the next day, I was eaten alive by them. I now have welts all over my body. I am totally skeeved out. My only hope is I did not bring them home with me.

Welcome check-in was pleasant and my King Junior Suite was nice. While it was not the same luxurious junior suite assigned during my last stay, it was still nice. The suite was roomy, equipped with a refrigerator and Keurig coffee station, but the bathroom was tiny and out-of-scale to the room. There was not a microwave, but I know that one can be requested for a small fee. The hotel provides complimentary in-room internet service for Hilton Honors Members and offers plenty of free parking. The Bistro Z restaurant and bar offer a good selection as the only restaurant in walking distance is a diner across the street. The Bistro serves a great breakfast buffet, offers menu items and provides the complimentary breakfast coupon for Hilton Honors. The property is well-maintained and during this stay, painting was underway on my wing. The hotel staff is very helpful and Zena S. was very nice in assisting me with securing a particular room for two upcoming stays. Overall, another good stay at the Doubletree Tarrytown.
reviews.title: Another Good Stay at the Doubletree Tarrytown

reviews.text: I was at the hotel for a 4 night 5 day business trip to the NY area- the rooms were clean and the front area/bar/restaurant were all very nice- at 2:00 in the morning on Sunday morning, the fire alarm went off- Bryan was working the front desk and was nice and helpful to all in what had to be a tough situation for him, as some people were not nice to him, as he only had limited information about the fire(and there was one, by the way). As a former volunteer firefighter, I was impressed that the hotel had compartmentalized fire doors to keep my area from filling with smoke from the other end of the hotel. Bryan deserves a big A+ for his work in keeping some sanity during the situation- to be fair, the night manager and a couple of other employees were working on where the fire was and were getting people out of the building at the time.
reviews.title: Bryan Johnson helped save the day...

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel with excellent front desk staff! Good location for day trips to NYC.
reviews.title: Perfect for NY day trips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good!
reviews.title: Comfortable, but...

reviews.text: The Doubletree in Tarrytown is a sprawling split-level complex from the '60s that isn't really attractive from the outside, but the room was comfortable. It was a very busy weekend during which the hotel accommodated a convention and at least one very large wedding. The staff seemed efficient and were helpful when asked for information about train service and other restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: 60s Style in the 'Burbs

reviews.text: I would advise anyone staying at the Doubletree to avoid the hotel restaurant due to the high cost and limited menu. We arrived on a Friday night and headed for the restaurant, but left quickly when we saw the prices. The menu was mostly high end main courses, with no sandwiches or other economical choices. There is a good diner across the street that we went to for breakfast a couple of days, and a very good Italian restaurant called "Capri" that is about a mile down the road.
reviews.title: Wake up, Hilton! Even McDonald's has free internet!

reviews.text: We were in town to attend a family wedding at another facility, and the Doubletree was a reasonable choice. If I find myself in Tarrytown again, I would consider a stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet but thats about all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rolling in late one night, exhausted and without reservations, my husband & checked into this hotel knowing nothing about it. It seemed to be the only hotel in the area. This is a large hotel, seemingly aimed at conventions and other large groups. The ambiance is impersonal but the front desk personnel were pleasant. Our room was large, the beds comfortable, the linens very nice. The bathroom was a bit small but adequate and clean. Then it came time to check in with my elderly parents via email (too late to call!). What's this? $4.95 daily to use the internet? When you can go to almost any other hotel and get complimentary internet use? When you can go to any McDonald, coffee house, even some entire towns and get free internet use? What century are you in, Hilton? Get with the program! (Add to this that the maid knocked on our door at 9am to see if we were ready to check out so she could clean the room! Check out is 11am. Why did she think we'd be checking out 2 hours early?)
reviews.title: Great for a short stay

reviews.text: You can do better elsewhere. There was virtually no customer service at the front desk. The maid didn't leave bath towels or coffee the first day. The second day no glasses, washcloths, coffee cups, coffee or creamer. Hotel is older and in need of renovations. The lighting in the bathroom was the worst I have ever encountered. Just tired and the staff needs some customer service training.
reviews.title: Helpful, friendly staff

reviews.text: Really expensive for what it is. The floor plan is very strange, took about 10 minutes to walk to my room, up and down three or four stairs a few times, which carrying a large suitcase, was not fun. Room was quiet. Half of my colleagues got their wake up call. The other half did not. In the morning, a few grabbed breakfast at their small breakfast nook, cereal and bagels. When they went to pay, it was $40 for the 'buffet.' Shocker!!! So be careful.
reviews.title: Really pricey but odd

likes.liked: — It was clean. Bathroom amenities were nice.
likes.disliked: — Stairs, long walk to room, $40 breakfast buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is still under renovation (almost completed), but our room was outstanding. Bedding was excellent, the service great. Very nice modern work out facility. We did not eat at the hotel, so we cannot rate the food or rooom service. But given a great Priceline weekend rate, we were delighted with our stay.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just stayed in the recently renovated Doubletree Hotel. It was rated three and a half stars on one of the travel websites so I thought it would be nicer than the Sheraton Hotel I stayed in over Thanksgiving. I was wrong.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were given a room on the 2nd floor. We went in our room and found the light not working and the bulb on the bed. We found a person who I believed might have been the manager and she apologized and said she would call the service person to fix it. While waiting I decided to look in the bathroom and found it was dirty. It hadn't been cleaned. I told the same person and she apologized again and changed our room..
reviews.title: Dirty, stained carpets, poor climate control- horrible

reviews.text: The second room appeared to have new furniture, rugs, and beds. The bathroom seemed to be clean. When we pulled down the comforter on one of the beds the sheet had some kind of stain. We called housekeeping who came and said the sheets were clean but a batch of them had stains and that they should not have been put on the bed. They apologized and changed our sheets. The desk had some spots on it which we wiped ourselves.
reviews.title: excellent hotel & location
Unassuming hotel had great rooms
reviews.text: There are many hotels in this area such as the 2 Marriots and a Hampton Inn. Most are business hotels which means that it is nice and clean but not luxurious.

Hotel from outside was alright but when you walked in, it was surprisingly nice in there. The rooms were even better. The furniture was stylish and sheek while the beds were very comfortable. And the room was LARGE. It had two beds, a table, leather armchairs, and still a lot of room left. If there is any problems, call maintenance, they will come check it out immediately. The cookie when you check in is delicious and you can go back for seconds.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: The breakfast is nice and varied and the restaurant, for a business hotel restaurant was very good. Tons of higher end menu items to go with the standard bar menu as well. Steak au Poive was good.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, what a perfect little stay,
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a recent trip to Tarrytown, NY I had the pleasure of staying at the Doubletree. From Check-in to departure everything was wonderful. The staff was very accommodating. We had drinks and appetizers at the bar which were all delicious!
reviews.title: good amenities, convenient location, so-so customer service

reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about the Doubletree Tarrytown.
reviews.title: Just So-So Hotel...

reviews.text: On one hand, the service and amenities are great, but on the other hand, there is a lot of room for improvement.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby: The hotel lobby is a gorgeous lodge-type lobby. And thank goodness it’s the first impression that you get of the hotel. I’m glad that the lobby is so attractive, because the rooms and hallways certainly aren’t.
reviews.title: excellent example of lodging

reviews.text: Amenities: The hotel has an indoor pool, gym, business center, restaurant, and many meeting/banquet rooms. The only amenities that I used were the gym, business center and restaurant. The gym is very nice for a hotel gym. It has three treadmills, three ellipticals, one bike, one stairstepper, weights, an all-in-one machine, medicine balls, and a couple of yoga mats – essentially everything you need for a decent workout.
reviews.title: Really Impressed with the Tarrytown Doubletree

reviews.text: The business center has two computers, a printer, and a fax machine.
reviews.title: Surprisingly cozy feel

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Tarrytown Hotel Tarrytown
description: TripAdvisor of Excellence Award Winner 2013 and 2012 Doubletree by Hilton Tarrytown offers visitors the perfect location to explore history, dining, shopping, nature and entertainment and do business in between. Located in Westchester County, 25 minutes north of New York City just off I-87 and I-287, the hotel is easily accessible by air, car or train. Once you arrive, this unique hotel offers comfort and convenience in a relaxed atmosphere. The indoor pool, 24 hour fitness center, Day Spa, Restaurant and Lounge, Women's sauna and men's steam room complements a perfect travel experience. Since it re-opened, the hotel has been satisfying one customer at a time. Come and see it for yourself.
